meanings.definition: Excessive pride in one's own achievements or qualities.
meanings.sent1: Her vaingloriousness was evident in the way she constantly boasted about her accomplishments.
meanings.sent2: His vaingloriousness often rubbed people the wrong way as he always talked about himself.
meanings.sent3: Despite his vaingloriousness, he couldn't even tie his own shoelaces without help.
meanings.sent4: The king's vaingloriousness blinded him to the needs of his people.
meanings.sent5: The sheer vaingloriousness of her demeanor made her hard to be around.

meanings.definition: The quality of being excessively proud or boastful.
meanings.sent1: The vaingloriousness of his speeches made everyone roll their eyes.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand his vaingloriousness and often avoided him at parties.
meanings.sent3: His vaingloriousness reached new heights when he claimed he could fly.
meanings.sent4: The vaingloriousness of the peacock as it strutted around the garden was comical.
meanings.sent5: The vaingloriousness of the villain made him a memorable character in the story.

meanings.definition: A feeling of excessive pride or self-importance.
meanings.sent1: Her vaingloriousness made her believe she was better than everyone else.
meanings.sent2: The team captain's vaingloriousness often led to conflicts within the group.
meanings.sent3: Despite his vaingloriousness, he was actually quite insecure deep down.
meanings.sent4: The vaingloriousness of the celebrity was shattered when they faced criticism for their actions.
meanings.sent5: The vaingloriousness of the politician was evident in every speech they gave.
